title: Opioid Overdose Response Competency Strengthening Education Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic first-aid knowledge and understanding of medication administration procedures
context.additional_context: A blended learning course combining online pre-learning and post-assessment, centered on a 3-hour practical session.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify five symptoms of opioid overdose.
Learners can explain and demonstrate at least three steps of naloxone administration procedures.
Learners can perform emergency response protocols with over 80% accuracy in patient simulation scenarios.
Learners can achieve a 20% or higher score improvement in pre-post knowledge assessments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
